data.description:
**Includes all free Horde updates*

VR meets the zombie apocalypse! Arizona Sunshine® is the original zombie shooter rebuilt entirely for Oculus Quest. Powered by 360° gameplay freedom, the untethered Arizona Sunshine® experience immerses you and up to 3 fellow survivors in a world overrun by zombies more than ever. 
![{"height":795,"type":"image","width":2160}](https://scontent.oculuscdn.com/v/t64.5771-25/39031557_3626363874273795_2213036774982029544_n.png?_nc_cat=100&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=6e7a0a&_nc_ohc=Eb-9yKdtSCkQ7kNvgGJxc7O&_nc_ht=scontent.oculuscdn.com&oh=00_AYDWKjSY3_iw6ihjs8QnGIhD5Ebs89hAVbkAli47nhLj0Q&oe=667E7F1E)
When you hear a flash of a human voice on the radio, your hopes surge - there are survivors out in the blistering heat of the post-apocalyptic Grand Canyon state! Armed with little more than your motion-controlled weapons and the scarce ammo and consumables you find along the way, you need to navigate hordes of zombies in your desperate search for survivors.

- Co-op multiplayer: Join forces with a friend in campaign mode or Horde mode for up to 4 Oculus Quest players
- Handle 25+ weapons with real-life movements
- Complete a full campaign, solo or in co-op
- Freely explore huge environments including deserts, canyons & mines

![{"height":585,"type":"image","width":2160}](https://scontent.oculuscdn.com/v/t64.5771-25/75334052_1174569843572059_2053476369608362596_n.png?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=6e7a0a&_nc_ohc=s2lhVHz325cQ7kNvgFkkFbD&_nc_ht=scontent.oculuscdn.com&oh=00_AYDybmX7z7r8qptzc5vlE0Xg-q9OJeoCWl1JXiEUjJaGVQ&oe=667EAEB1)

New:
- Oculus group launch support

- Added Circle tooltip option

- Added separate voice language option

Improvements:
- Changed lightmap texture compression for all levels, making it less blocky
- Improved some areas in the campaign to bring them on the same quality as the rest
- Changed texture filtering from bilinear to trilinear, reducing seams

Bug fixes:
- Fixed tracer appearing to go backwards when shooting something close to the barrel origin
- Fixed dead players body blocking zombies
- Fixed pistol not correctly appearing to be empty
- Fixed an issue that you couldn't switch the console gun with cartridges
- Fixed damned cartridge not being reset properly in the menu
- Fixed 'One-Man Militia' and 'Online' Deadman DLC achievements
- Fixed a lighting bug that most of the time the specular reflections were not properly rendered

New Campaign DLC added "The Damned".
Added One-handed weapon only "Classic" Horde Mode, includes single-hand versions of Spectre, MP4 and Super Shorty.
Seperate leaderboards for Classic Horde Mode.

- An all-new campaign mission taking place before the events of Arizona Sunshine
- Online co-op functionality for up to two players
- A range of difficulty degrees including the insane Apocalyptic Mode!
- Six new achievements spread across an infested missile silo
- Three new weapons: A fully automatic submachine gun, a two-handed shotgun and a tactical handgun

New Features:
- Introducing the 'Undead valley' hordemode map
- Added functionality to drop weapons by holding a 'eject ammo' (A/B/X/Y) button

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed B/Y buttons now properly eject ammo again
- Tweaked anti-cheat colliders above crates in horde mode

The update includes the following changes to Arizona Sunshine Quest:
- Introducing the 'Old mine' horde mode map
- Notifications are a bit bigger so they are easier to read
- Fixed crash that sometimes happens in multiplayer games
- Fixed an error when starting multiplayer games
- Fixed clip size of the M2 Carbine gun

- Two handed weapon mode
	- Campaign with two handed guns
	- Horde mode now has both one-handed and two-handed guns available
- Tweaked/Improved interactions quality (Interacting with cars/doors/ammo/reloading no longer causes the screen to go black)
- Fixed bug that sometimes the winch is not present in the level 'Bridge'
- Fixed achievement 'Quack quack %$#@!'
- Fixed an issue where players could sit inside the geometry in the horde mode level
- Fixed an issue where players would get stuck when they teleport down the ladder at the radio in the level 'Trailerpark”

- Implemented Rich Presence
- Minor changes to gun raytracing
